reviewText: One of the better Nancy Drew games, it kept me interested in all the puzzles right to the end. I would have played all in one sitting if I had enough time!

reviewText: This is one of the better Nancy Drew games that I've played. It's at that perfect balance between the simplicity of the older games, and the new types of features that seem to bog down the newer games too much. The puzzles were all fun, which I admit isn't something I'd usually say about a Nancy Drew game.

reviewText: Huge Nancy Drew nerd here and I have to say that this is one of my favorite Nancy Drew games. Not just because Frank and Joe Hardy are along for the ride, but for the entire plot of the mystery and finding Jake Hurley's treasure." My favorite part is putting all the gems in the machine and watching the entire room light up once everything is working. Also

recommended: the shoes were back in their original spot. If you didn't write it down

reviewText: Definitely one of my favorite Nancy Drew games. The Hardy Brothers were a fun addition and I especially liked how I didn't have to spend large amounts of time wandering aimlessly around to find things as the train is much easier to get used to, in my personal opinion. If you're a fan of Nancy Drew games, or just want a fun mystery point-and-click to pass the time, get it!

reviewText: this game gets a little fustrating but if you like puzzles go for it

My feelings are a little mixed on this game. For the most part, it's fun with a good atmosphere and entertaining characters. But while most of the puzzles are decent, when they stumble, they stumble HARD. For instance, there's one puzzle that never indicates to you that you can't solve it fully. If I hadn't looked at a walkthrough, I would have continued bashing my head against that puzzle indefinitely. There's also another plot-critical puzzle that is almost impossible to intuit on your own. (There are also a ridiculous number of steps to it) And the ending is a frustrating series of 50/50 chance rolls where if you mess up, you have to start again from the beginning.\n\nThat said, if you don't mind playing a Nancy Drew game with walkthrough in hand, this is a fine game. There were definitely times I felt excited and satisfied by what was happening--I just couldn't fully get past all of the frustrating game design choices. And if you love HerInteractive's interpretation of The Hardy Boys, then *definitely* pick this one up!
Classic Nancy Drew, Excellent Game. Hard puzzles but fun to figure out. Really good storyline.

Positive rating just for the soul fact that the Hardy Boys are in it!

Aside from that, limited amount of exploring outside of the train and the mystery is pretty straight forward. Game was fun though so that made up for any of the faults. A decent ND titile and certainly nice to see the Hardy Boys in person in a game and get their help real time.

Biggest gripe was Frank Hardy's voice actor, too deep and didn't fit at all. Very minor issue but it stuck out like a sore thumb whenever he spoke.

reviewText: I have played several Nancy Drew games, and this one is my favorite so far! Perfect balance of characters, creepiness, fun, and puzzles. Loved it. Plus, who doesn't love the Hardy Boys? Cheeseburgers.

I am very pleased with Last Train to Blue Moon Canyon. At first I did not know what to expect but I loved every minute of it. You get to work along side with the Hardy Boys on a really cool train as well as getting to meet a character you only get to talk to in Secrete of Shadow Ranch by phone (I'll let you figure out who). The other characters in the game are wonderful and diverse, the puzzles are just challanging enough to make you think and the story behind the mystery is really nice. I would definately recomend this game to anyone who is looking for a good fun mystery. :)
One of the best in the Nancy Drew series. The back and forth on the train can feel tedious at times, but the environment, the NPCs, and the puzzles are all great. Highly reccomended.
One of the better ones. Quite entertaining.
This game is a point and click mystery game, where you can't put the game down.\nFull of twists and turns- Puzzles and more! Go off and solve a mystery with Nancy Drew!
